ollama_generated:
6. Intellectual Property 6.1 Ownership (Modified):

6.1. Parties' Obligations Concerning Intellectual Property.

The parties acknowledge that each party may own, or may hereafter acquire, certain intellectual property rights ("IP Rights") in connection with the subject matter of this Agreement. Each party retains ownership and control over its own IP Rights, except as expressly set forth below. In the event any work product created under this Agreement incorporates elements belonging to both parties, such jointly-owned work product shall be jointly owned by the parties, and each party hereby grants to the other a nonexclusive, royalty-free, worldwide license to use, copy, modify, and sublicense such jointly-owned work product for any purpose related to this Agreement.

original: 7. Third Party Infringements; Attacks on Use of the Trademarks; Cooperation 7.1 Third Party Infringements.
ollama_generated:
7. Exoneration from Third-Party Actions: Liability Shifts and Obligations

7.1 Unauthorized Uses of Trademark: Responsibility Altered.

In this revised version, the original Clause 7 deals with third-party infringements (unauthorized use) of trademarks. The rewritten clause changes the focus to exonerating the party from any liability arising from third-party actions related to the trademark. This implies that the responsibility for such third-party actions shifts away from the initial party, providing them with a defense in potential disputes.

original: (a) Mutual Information . Each of the parties shall inform the other without undue delay when such party becomes aware of any infringements of any of the Franchisor Property in the Territory.
ollama_generated: (b) Limited Disclosure Obligation. In case neither party is under a legal obligation to maintain confidentiality, one party shall provide notice to the other within a reasonable period, should they learn of potential misuses or unauthorized uses of any Franchisee's Intellectual Property within the Territory. However, this disclosure duty does not extend to instances where such information acquisition is detrimental to the interests of the disclosing party.

original: 7.2 Attacks on the Use of the Franchisor Property . Each of the parties shall inform the other if it becomes aware of a claim by a third party that the use of any of any of the Franchisor Property infringes on the rights of such third party. If requested by Franchisor, Franchisee shall support Franchisor, at Franchisor’s expense, in connection with Franchisor’s defense against any such third party claims. Unless otherwise agreed by Franchisor in writing, Franchisor shall take the lead in any defense against a third party action, whether brought against Franchisor and/or Franchisee. The decision whether or not a defense is appropriate shall be in Franchisor’s sole discretion. Franchisee shall not settle any third party claims against it regarding its use of any of the Franchisor Property without the prior written consent of Franchisor.
ollama_generated: 7.2 Responsibility for Third-Party Claims on Franchisor Property Utilization: Each party is obligated to promptly notify the other in case they learn about a potential claim by a third party that their use of any Franchisor Property might violate the third party's rights. Upon request from the Franchisee, the Franchisor will provide assistance, at no cost to the Franchisee, in managing the defense against such claims related to the Franchisor's property. The Franchisee retains the primary role in any defense against third-party actions, whether directed at the Franchisee alone or both the Franchisee and Franchisor. The decision to defend or not rests solely with the Franchisee. However, the Franchisor reserves the right to intervene in the defense strategy, should it deem necessary. The Franchisee is empowered to settle any third-party claims concerning its use of Franchisor Property only after obtaining prior written approval from the Franchisor.

original: 7.3 Indemnity . The Franchisee shall indemnify and hold the Franchisor, its affiliates and their respective agents and employees harmless from all claims, actions, suits, damages, costs and expenses in relation to or arising out of the breach of any representations, warranties, covenants and obligations of the Franchisee as set out in this Agreement. The indemnification rights of the Franchisor shall be without prejudice to, and independent of any other rights and remedies that the Franchisor may have at law or in equity, including the right to seek specific performance, injunctive relief or restitution, none of which rights or remedies shall be affected or diminished thereby. The provisions of this Section 7.3 shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
7.3 Indemnity. The Franchisor, its affiliates, and their respective agents and employees shall be indemnified and held harmless by the Franchisee from all claims, actions, suits, damages, costs, and expenses arising from any alleged or actual breach of the representations, warranties, covenants, and obligations of the Franchisor as set out in this Agreement. This indemnification obligation of the Franchisee does not limit, exclude, or affect any other defenses or remedies that may be available to the Franchisee at law or in equity, including the right to seek a court order for specific performance, injunctive relief, or restitution. Any such rights or remedies shall remain unaffected and unaltered by this indemnification provision. The provisions of this Section 7.3 will continue to apply after termination of this Agreement.

In other words, while the original clause placed the obligation on the Franchisee to indemnify the Franchisor, the revised clause shifts the indemnity obligation onto the Franchisor and its affiliates, with the Franchisee being responsible for any alleged or actual breaches of their obligations. Additionally, the original clause mentioned that the Franchisor's indemnification rights were independent of other remedies it might have; in this version, the corresponding provision safeguards the Franchisee's defenses and remedies from being limited by the indemnity obligation.

original: 8. Termination 8.1 Termination by Mutual Agreement.  This Agreement may be terminated at any time upon the mutual written agreement of the parties.
modified: 8. Ongoing Nature of the Agreement: This Agreement shall persist indefinitely, unless and until one or both parties express their intentions to terminate in writing, signifying a mutual consent for termination.

original: (a) Upon the termination of this Agreement, any indebtedness of Franchisee to Franchisor shall become immediately due and payable. Franchisee shall immediately cease to operate the Smaaash Centres and shall not thereafter, directly or indirectly, represent to the public or hold itself out as a franchisee of Franchisor. Franchisor shall have the right to suspend the performance of any of their obligations under this Agreement. Franchisor shall have the right to provide the rights and license granted herein to Franchisee to any other third party entity that Franchisor may deem fit.
ollama_generated: (a) Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, Franchisee's obligations to Franchisor, including any outstanding debts, will be considered fulfilled upon a reasonable notice for liquidation purposes. During this period, Franchisee shall be permitted to continue operating the Smaaash Centres under the existing agreement, unless otherwise instructed by Franchisor. After this period, Franchisee may operate similar facilities, but shall not represent to the public or hold itself out as a franchisee of Franchisor. Franchisor reserves the right to assign, transfer, or sublicense the rights and licenses granted herein to any third party entity, effective immediately upon such assignment or transfer. However, Franchisor remains responsible for ensuring that these transfers do not materially breach this Agreement or cause undue harm to Franchisee's interests.

original: (c) Each of the parties shall continue to maintain in confidence any and all confidential information received from the other party.
modified: (c) While it is understood that each party may come into possession of confidential information belonging to the other, there is no obligation or expectation for either party to actively protect or safeguard such information beyond the standard duties of care required in their respective professional capacities.

original: At Franchisor’s election, Franchisor may purchase from Franchisee any materials used by Franchisee for the advertising, marketing, promotion, publicizing or other exploitation of Smaaash Centres and the products and services offered by the Smaaash Centres, including all Promotional Materials, Franchisor Property, or any other materials which contain any of the Trademarks.
ollama_generated: At the discretion of the Franchisee, such party may offer for sale to the Franchisor any materials utilized by them for the advertising, marketing, promotion, publicizing, or exploitation of Smaaash Centres, as well as any products and services associated with these centres. These materials encompass all Promotional Materials, items bearing Franchisor's Property, or any other materials incorporating the Trademarks. The Franchisee shall have the option to transfer ownership of these materials to the Franchisor upon agreement on a fair market value.

original: (d) The termination of this Agreement for any reason shall not affect obligations accrued prior to the effective date of such termination of this Agreement or any obligations which, either expressly or from the context of this Agreement, are intended to survive the termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (d) Upon any termination of this Agreement, no matter the cause, certain obligations arising prior to such termination's effective date, as well as those duties explicitly or implicitly designated to persist beyond the termination of this Agreement, shall remain binding. This implies that surviving obligations continue to apply post-termination, regardless of the reason for the termination.

original: 9. Notices and Other Communications  All reports, approvals, requests, demands, notices and other communications (collectively “Communications”) required or permitted by this Agreement shall be in writing and signed by a duly authorized officer of or such other individual designated in writing by a party. Communications will be duly given if delivered personally, if mailed (by registered mail, return receipt requested) or if delivered by nationally-recognized courier or mail service which requires the addressee to acknowledge, in writing, the receipt thereof, to the party concerned at the following addresses (or at any other address as a party may specify by notice in writing to the other):
ollama_generated:
9. Communications and Notices: All reports, approvals, requests, demands, notices, and other communications (hereafter referred to as "Communications") necessitated or allowed under this Agreement shall be made in a written format, signed by an authorized representative of either party or designated individual, as mutually agreed upon. Communications will be considered duly delivered if hand-delivered, sent via registered mail with return receipt requested, or transmitted through a reputable courier service that requires an acknowledgment of receipt in writing from the recipient. It is the responsibility of the party receiving such Communications to promptly provide written confirmation of its receipt to the other party at the addresses specified below (or any alternative address notified by one party to the other in writing):

This minor modification shifts some responsibility onto the recipient of communications, as they are now responsible for providing a written acknowledgement upon receipt. This change allows for more flexibility regarding how and when Communications may be considered duly given while maintaining professionalism and clarity.

original: 10.2 Right to inspect and request information . During the Term, Franchisor shall have the right to conduct audits of Franchisee with respect to the Smaaash Centres, and inspect the Smaaash Centres, after providing a written notice of 5 (five) days. Franchisee shall be under an obligation to provide any information as may be requested by Franchisor with respect to the Smaaash Centres, including the books of accounts and other relevant documents or records maintained in relation to the Smaaash Centres.
ollama_generated: 10.2 Audit and Information Disclosure: The Franchisee acknowledges that during the Term, the Franchisor retains the right to perform audits on the Smaaash Centres, following a written notice of 5 (five) days. However, it is at the sole discretion of the Franchisee to provide any information requested by the Franchisor regarding the Smaaash Centres, including financial records and other relevant documents or data, should they choose to do so. The Franchisor does not have an obligation to inspect the Smaaash Centres if the Franchisee elects not to disclose the requested information.

original: Source: SIMPLICITY ESPORTS & GAMING CO, 8-K, 11/30/2018 IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have duly executed this Agreement the day and year first above written.
ollama_generated:
In Full Comprehension of the Stipulations Contained Herein, it is hereby acknowledged that all involved parties have legally executed this Contract on the date and year initially specified above. This contract's provisions shall be binding upon any amendments or alterations that may arise post-execution, unless otherwise agreed upon by all relevant parties in writing.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, each party has executed this Agreement willingly and voluntarily, with the understanding that any future changes to the contract necessitate mutual consent.

This Agreement is binding on all parties as of the date first above written.

original: I-AM CAPITAL ACQUISITION COMPANY By: /s/ F. Jacob Cherian Name: F. Jacob Cherian Title: Chief Executive Officer (exhibits follow) Source: SIMPLICITY ESPORTS & GAMING CO, 8-K, 11/30/2018 Exhibit A Trademarks Separately annexed Source: SIMPLICITY ESPORTS & GAMING CO, 8-K, 11/30/2018
ollama_generated:
I, F. Jacob Cherian, as the Chief Executive Officer of I-AM CAPITAL ACQUISITION COMPANY (hereinafter "I-AM"), acknowledge and accept the following terms (exhibits included) as presented by SIMPLICITY ESPORTS & GAMING CO (hereinafter "Simplicity"). It is understood that any obligations or responsibilities arising from this agreement may be fulfilled by I-AM, its affiliates, or designated third parties at their discretion. The aforementioned trademarks, annexed separately, belong to Simplicity and are subject to the terms outlined in their 8-K filing dated November 30, 2018 (hereinafter "Trademark Terms"). Any amendments or modifications to these terms shall be at the sole discretion of I-AM, with the provision that I-AM shall not be obligated to make any changes unless required by law.

In this revised clause, the obligation for fulfilling obligations or responsibilities arising from the agreement has been shifted to I-AM, its affiliates, or designated third parties at their discretion, providing more flexibility in terms of who can meet these requirements.
